content.description: <math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge aqueous colorless plus S C N with a negative 1 charge aqueous colorless is in equilibrium with F e S C N with a positive 2 charge aqueous red" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Colorless</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>+</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Colorless</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>⇄</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Red</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: When colorless solutions containing <math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ions and <math alttext="S C N with a negative 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ions are combined, a deep-red complex ion, <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> quickly forms, as shown in the net ionic equation above. Which of the following explains the observation that adding a few additional crystals of <math alttext="K S C N solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KSCN</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> results in the red color of the solution becoming deeper?

choices.label: The added <math alttext="K S C N solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KSCN</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves, disturbing the charge balance in the solution, causing <math alttext="F e open parenthesis S C N close parenthesis 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext><mtext>(SCN)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to precipitate as a red solid.

The added <math alttext="K S C N solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KSCN</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves, causing the solution to become saturated in <math alttext="S C N with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions, which appear red at high concentrations.

The added <math alttext="K S C N solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KSCN</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves, causing the reaction system to respond by producing more product to partially consume <math alttext="S C N with a negative 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and reduce its concentration.

The added <math alttext="K S C N solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KSCN</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves, causing the reaction system to respond by forming more <math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions, which have a deep orange color at high concentrations.

content.answer: The added <math alttext="K S C N solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KSCN</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves, causing the reaction system to respond by producing more product to partially consume <math alttext="S C N with a negative 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and reduce its concentration.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
